isis.stitle: STEERING COLUMN ASSEMBLY, STANDARD AND TILT - 2000, 3000, 4000, 8000 - UNIVERSAL JOINTS - ASSEMBLE

step1.para: Make certain parts are clean before assembly.
Rest yoke on hard surface. Tap one bearing part way into yoke with a soft hammer ( Figure 9). Be certain bearings are straight in yoke.

figure.caption: Figure 9. Tap Bearing Part Way Into Yoke

step1.para: Insert spider through the opposite hole, without bearing, and swing it into place and down into the partially installed bearing.
Turn assembly over and tap the opposite bearing part way into the yoke. Be certain to start bearing straight in yoke.
Place yoke in vise with bearings against jaws of vise. Tighten vise slowly and the bearings will be pressed into the yoke as shown in Figure 10.

figure.caption: Figure 10. Bearings Are Pressed Into Yoke

step1.para: After pressing bearing into yoke, the spider may be off center in yoke. This is desirable because it permits installation of snap ring on the side with the most clearance. Refer to Figure 11and install snap ring.

After the first snap ring is in place, turn assembly over. The bearing with snap ring installed should be on the bottom. Rest yoke on vise and strike bearing which is on top. This will seat both bearings. Snap rings should rest against inside milled surface of yoke. Install remaining snap ring.
Bearings must move freely. If tight, tap yoke until free.
